thread.title: Kevin Durant builds court for Oklahoma City kids
thread.title_full: Kevin Durant builds court for Oklahoma City kids

title: Kevin Durant builds court for Oklahoma City kids
text:
Posted: 9:35 p.m. Monday, Oct. 5, 2015 Kevin Durant builds court for Oklahoma City kids Oklahoma City Thunder forward Kevin Durant smiles as he answers a question during media day in Oklahoma City, Monday, Sept. 28, 2015. (AP Photo/Sue Ogrocki) Sponsored Links Oklahoma City, Okla. â€” 
Kevin Durant unveiled his new basketball court for kids at North Highland Elementary School in Oklahoma City. 
The dedication ceremony took place Monday morning in front of the children. 
It's all part of the Kevin Durant Charity Foundation program Build It And They Will Come. 
The court at North Highland Elemtary is the first in North America. The first court he built was in Germany. KD hopes to continue building these courts across the continent. 

During the ceremony Durant took the first (and second) shot on the court, and played basketball with the kids. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
